channel.title: The Official jQuery Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Weekly interviews and news with key jQuery community members.
channel.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly show that aims to interview key members of the jQuery Community and present jQuery news from the past week. The show is co-hosted by Ralph Whitbeck and Rey Bango both members of the jQuery Developer Relations team.
channel.description: A weekly show that aims to interview key members of the jQuery Community and present jQuery news from the past week. The show is co-hosted by Ralph Whitbeck and Rey Bango both members of the jQuery Developer Relations team.

item.title: 46 - Q&A Panel from jQCon
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: John Resig, Richard Worth, Adam Sontag, Dan Heberden, Leah Silber and Scott Jehl answers questions from the audience at jQuery Conference 2011 in San Francisco.
item.itunes:summary: John Resig, Richard Worth, Adam Sontag, Dan Heberden, Leah Silber and Scott Jehl answers questions from the audience at jQuery Conference 2011 in San Francisco.

item.title: 45 - jQuery UI Keynote
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Richard D. Worth presents the state of jQuery UI and a preview of the jQuery UI Grid project from the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area.
item.itunes:summary: Richard D. Worth presents the state of jQuery UI and a preview of the jQuery UI Grid project from the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area.

item.title: 44 - jQuery 1.5 - 1.6.1
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with jQuery Core Team Member Dave Methvin about the last few releases.
item.itunes:summary: We talk with jQuery Core Team Member Dave Methvin about the last few releases.

item.title: 43 - RewardJS
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Talk with Richard D. Worth about his personal project RewardJS to reward developers to fix bugs.
item.itunes:summary: Talk with Richard D. Worth about his personal project RewardJS to reward developers to fix bugs.

item.title: 42 - jQuery Mobile Keynote
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Todd Parker and Scott Jehl deliver the jQuery Mobile keynote from the jQuery Conference 2011: SF BAy Area. Follow along with the slides at http://filamentgroup.com/lab/slides_from_our_jquery_conference_presentation_on_jquery_mobile/
item.itunes:summary: Todd Parker and Scott Jehl deliver the jQuery Mobile keynote from the jQuery Conference 2011: SF BAy Area. Follow along with the slides at http://filamentgroup.com/lab/slides_from_our_jquery_conference_presentation_on_jquery_mobile/

item.title: 41 - jQuery Keynote
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: John Resig delivers the jQuery Keynote from the jQuery Conference 2011: SF Bay Area
item.itunes:summary: John Resig delivers the jQuery Keynote from the jQuery Conference 2011: SF Bay Area. Follow along with John's slides at http://www.slideshare.net/jeresig/jquery-keynote-spring-2011

item.title: 40 - Wijmo
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Bannon from ComponentOne talks about Wijmo a new UI Library based on jQuery UI.
item.itunes:summary: Chris Bannon from ComponentOne talks about Wijmo a new UI Library based on jQuery UI.

item.title: 39 - jQuery Mobile
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: John Resig joins us to talk about jQuery Mobile.
item.itunes:summary: John Resig joins us to talk about jQuery Mobile.

item.title: 38 - jQuery 1.4.3
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: John Resig joins us to talk about the latest jQuery release, 1.4.3.
item.itunes:summary: John Resig joins us to talk about the latest jQuery release, 1.4.3.

item.title: 37 - Ben Nadel
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: We sit down with Ben Nadel and discuss Cold Fusion and the jQuery Conference this past weekend.
item.itunes:summary: Fresh off the jQuery Conference 2010: Boston, we sit down with Ben Nadel and talk about the conference. Ben tells us about what he learned and tells us about the awesome photo he got with the jQuery Community. Benâ€™s a jQuery spokesperson for the Cold Fusion community and we talk about that as well.

item.title: 36 - Bocoup
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: We sit down with Boaz Sender and Ben Alman who both work for Bocoup in Boston, MA. We discuss Bocoup from their clients to their open source contributions.
item.itunes:summary: We sit down with Boaz Sender and Ben Alman who both work for Bocoup in Boston, MA. We discuss Bocoup from their clients to their open source contributions. Bocoup is providing the pre-conference training in Boston and we talk about the training class and the advance classes that are also offered. Bocoup Loft also hosts many events including jQuery Meetups in Boston.

item.title: 35 - jQuery UI 1.8.5
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott GonzÃ¡lez, Lead Developer for jQuery UI joins us to talk about the latest release of jQuery UI and the road ahead.
item.itunes:summary: Scott GonzÃ¡lez, Lead Developer for jQuery UI joins us to talk about the latest release of jQuery UI and the road ahead.

item.title: 34 - Karl Swedberg pt. 2
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Karl Swedberg joins us again this week to chat about Learning jQuery and the upcoming jQuery conference.
item.itunes:summary: Karl Swedberg joins us again this week to chat about Learning jQuery and the upcoming jQuery conference.

item.title: 33 - Karl Swedberg pt. 1
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Karl Swedberg joins us this week to chat about the community needs of jQuery and what we know now nine months after api.jquery.com has launched.
item.itunes:summary: Karl Swedberg joins us this week to chat about the community needs of jQuery and what we know now nine months after api.jquery.com has launched.

item.title: 32 - Dave Ward
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave Ward co host of the video series on Tekpub called Master jQuery
item.itunes:summary: Talk with Dave Ward about the Master jQuery series on Tekpub and caching on Google CDN, etc.

item.title: 31 - Filament Group
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Filament Group, discussing Progressive Enhancement, jQuery UI and Mobile.
item.itunes:summary: We talk to the folks at Filament Group about Progressive Enhancement, jQuery UI and Mobile..

item.title: 30 - Chris Coyier
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Coyier of css-tricks.com and Wufoo.
item.itunes:summary: We talk to Chris Coyier about jQuery, css-tricks.com and Wufoo .

item.title: 29 - Rey Bomb #3
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: The guys get together and discuss Script Junkie and Mobile jQuery.
item.itunes:summary: We talk about a new front-end focused tutorial site, Script Junkies and we talk about the mobile strategy of jQuery.

item.title: 28 - Remy Sharp pt. 3 (jQuery for Designers)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Remy Sharp, jQuery Developer Relations Team member and jsbin.com creator
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down and talked with Remy Sharp and discussed jQuery for Designers, Full Frontal JavaScript Conference, Snap Bird and have a little fun.

item.title: 27 - Remy Sharp pt. 2 (HTML5)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Remy Sharp, jQuery Developer Relations Team member and jsbin.com creator
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down and talked with Remy Sharp and discussed HTML5.

item.title: 26 - Remy Sharp pt. 1 (jsbin.com)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Remy Sharp, jQuery Developer Relations Team member and jsbin.com creator
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down and talked with Remy Sharp and discussed jsbin.com a site to try out and share HTML and JavaScript quickly and easily.

item.title: 25 - Meeno Van Slooten
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Meeno Van Slooten was a speaker at the Bay Area jQuery Conference 2010 and showed off a cool new UI Testing Framework he developed.
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down with Meeno Van Slooten who was a speaker at the Bay Area jQuery Conference 2010 and showed off a cool new UI Testing Framework he developed.

item.title: 24 - yayQuery
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: The hosts of the yayQuery podcast talk with Rey and Ralph.
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down with the yayQuery hosts and discuss a bunch of topics.

item.title: 23 - Nicholas Zakas
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: Nicholas Zakas is a front-end engineer at Yahoo and author of the new book High Performance JavaScript
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down with Nicholas Zakas to talk about High Performance JavaScript.

item.title: 22 - James Senior
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Rey Bango
item.itunes:subtitle: James Senior is a Web Evengelist and we discuss Microsoft/jQuery and the new plugin proposals.
item.itunes:summary: This week we sat down with James Senior a Web Technology evangelist at Microsoft and discussed jQuery/Microsoft. We also announce Rey Bango as the new co-host of the show.

item.title: 21 - Rey Bomb 2
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck
item.itunes:subtitle: When Rey Bango comes on who knows what we will get. Rey Bomb episode number 2.
item.itunes:summary: This week we discuss JSConf, Rey's new position at Microsoft, Microsoft/jQuery relationship and jQuery Conference. This is also the last show for Elijah and he is stepping down to spend more time with family.

item.title: 20 - Barcamp Rochester
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck
item.itunes:subtitle: Various jQuery and JavaScript related interviews from Barcamp Rochester
item.itunes:summary: This week we provide you with three short interviews recorded at Barcamp Rochester earlier this month. John Resig gives us an update on the state of jQuery. Benjamin DeLillo tells us about a new WebGL library called WebGLU and Mich Cook of Yahoo introduces us to YUI3. Show notes: http://blog.jquery.com/2010/04/16/the-official-jquery-podcast-episode-20-barcamp-rochester

item.title: 19 - jQuery in Action, 2nd Ed.
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: The Authors of jQuery in Action
item.itunes:summary: This week we talked with Yehuda Katz and Bear Bibeault about the upcoming second edition of the popular jQuery in Action book from Manning. Show notes: http://blog.jquery.com/2010/04/09/the-official-jquery-podcast-episode-19-jquery-in-action-2nd-ed

item.title: 18 - Jeffery Way (Nettuts)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeffery Way, Editor of the site Nettuts
item.itunes:summary: This week we talked with Jeffrey Way. He is the editor of Nettuts+, and the Site Manager of ThemeForest and CodeCanyon. Jeffrey gives an overview of the Nettuts+ website and explains why their tutorials focus so much on jQuery and gives some examples of recent jQuery related articles. Show notes: http://blog.jquery.com/2010/04/02/the-official-jquery-podcast-episode-18-jeffery-way-nettuts

item.title: 17 - jQuery UI 1.8
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: jQuery UI team and the 1.8 release
item.itunes:summary: We talked last week with the jQuery UI team right before the launch of jQuery UI 1.8, Richard D. Worth, Scott Gonzalez, Mike Hostetler and Doug Neiner filled in for Elijah. We discuss the final release of jQuery UI 1.8.

item.title: 16 - jQuery Meetups
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: jQuery Meetups, ideas for your events
item.itunes:summary: We talk with Cody Lindley, Jonathan Sharp and Boaz Sender about meetups.jquery.com and try to help come up with ideas and process for hosting jQuery Meetups in your area.

item.title: 15 - John Resig (1.4.1 - 1.4.2)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: John Resig joins in to discuss the last two point releases
item.itunes:summary: We talk with John Resig about jQuery 1.4.1 and jQuery 1.4.2 as well as what's ahead in jQuery 1.4.3 and beyond.

item.title: 14 - Phil Haack
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Phil Haack, Senior Program Manager for ASP.NET MVC at Microsoft
item.itunes:summary: We talk with Phil Haack of Microsoft to talk about how jQuery is now included in Visual Studio and ASP.NET MVC and how easy it is to use.

item.title: 13 - David Walsh
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: David Walsh, Mootools developer talks about how Mootools and jQuery compare.
item.itunes:summary: We talk with Mootools developer David Walsh and discuss the relationship between our teams and compare the libraries.

item.title: 12 - Rey Bomb 1
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Rey Bango, Cody Lindley, Karl Swedberg and Doug Neiner Talk jQuery
item.itunes:summary: We talk about jQuery at a casual level and try to discuss some topics we normally wouldn't during an interview episode.

item.title: 11 - Yehuda Katz
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Yehuda Katz about Rails and jQuery.
item.itunes:summary: Our last show while in Washington DC we sat down and talked with Yehuda Katz about Rails 3 and jQuery.

item.title: 10 - appendTo
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: appendTo's Mike Hostetler & Jonathan Sharp talk about the new jQuery company
item.itunes:summary: We took the opportunity to sit down with Mike Hostetler and Jonathon Sharp to discuss appendTo. The first jQuery company that provides support, training and consultation at the Enterprise level.

item.title: 9 - David Artz, Aol.
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: David Artz, Director of Website Optimization at Aol.
item.itunes:summary: We took the opportunity to sit down with David Artz and discuss how jQuery is used at Aol.

item.title: 8 - api.jquery.com
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Karl Swedberg and Paul Irish talk about the new api.jquery.com site.
item.itunes:summary: The jQuery Documentation got a major facelift and was released during the 14 Days of jQuery. Find out what's new in the site.

item.title: 7 - jQuery 1.4 (John Resig)
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: jQuery 1.4 is now released!
item.itunes:summary: We are in Washington DC and we are all sitting face-to-face with John Resig as we talk about the jQuery 1.4 Release.

item.title: 6 - Ben Alman
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Ben Alman, jQuery Plugin Developer and Core Contributor
item.itunes:summary: We talk with Ben Alman about writing plugins and contributing to jQuery. Elijah joins us after getting braces on, much hilarity ensues.

item.title: 5 - Rey Bango
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Rey Bango, Head jQuery Evangelist
item.itunes:summary: Rey Bango is the Head jQuery Evangelist, he talks with us about evangelism and what to expect in 2010.

item.title: 4 - Cody Lindley
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Cody Lindley, jQuery Enlightenment Author and jQuery Evangelist
item.itunes:summary: Cody Lindley is the author of the e-book jQuery Enlightenment and the coauthor of jQuery Cookbook. Learn all about the recently released jQuery books.

item.title: 3 - Paul Irish
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul Irish, yayQuery cohost and front-end developer
item.itunes:summary: Paul Irish is a front-end developer and co-host of the other jQuery podcast called yayQuery.

item.title: 2 - Richard D. Worth
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: jQuery UI Release Manager, Richard D. Worth
item.itunes:summary: Richard D. Worth, Release Manager for the jQuery UI project joins us to explain jQuery UI and how you can contribute.

item.title: 1 - John Resig
item.itunes:author: Ralph Whitbeck & Elijah Manor
item.itunes:subtitle: Our first episode with guest John Resig
item.itunes:summary: John Resig joins us on our first podcast to talk jQuery, the Software Freedom Conservancy, the upcoming 1.4 release and why Google Groups is dead.
